original_title: Sri Lanka concludes free trade talks with Thailand
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has concluded talks on a trade pact with Thailand after nine rounds of negotiations and the cabinet has given the go ahead to sign an agreement early this year, Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.
Sri Lanka has to liberalize trade to make the country more export competitive and get access to foreign markets, he told reporters on January 02.
Both sides have agreed liberalize tariffs on a sensitive list of goods in 16 years instead of an earlier 18 years, he said.
The government hopes have a deal ready for signing when a Thai dignitary visit the country later this year, Gunawardana said. (Colombo/Jan03/2023)
